org.activebpel.rt.bpel.config
Interface IAeUpdatableEngineConfig

All Superinterfaces:
IAeEngineConfiguration
All Known Implementing Classes:
AeDefaultEngineConfiguration
public interface IAeUpdatableEngineConfig
extends IAeEngineConfiguration

Interface for the runtime mutable engine settings.

Method Detail

addNewFunctionContext

public void addNewFunctionContext(java.lang.String aName,
                                  java.lang.String aNamespace,
                                  java.lang.String aClassName,
                                  java.lang.String aLocation)
                           throws AeInvalidFunctionContextException,
                                  AeFunctionContextExistsException
Register a custom FunctionContext with the BPEL engine and persist it. Callers should ensure that the class specified is available on the classpath for the engine.

Parameters:
aName - Arbitrary (unique) name for the grouping.
aNamespace -
aClassName - Classname for a class that implements the FunctionContext interface.
aLocation - Location where the class can be found.
Throws:
AeInvalidFunctionContextException
AeFunctionContextExistsException

deleteFunctionContexts

public void deleteFunctionContexts(java.util.Collection aContextNames)
Unregister the custom FunctionContext objects with the given names and remove them from storage.

Parameters:
aContextNames -

setUnmatchedCorrelatedReceiveTimeout

public void setUnmatchedCorrelatedReceiveTimeout(int aTime)
Set the time the engine will hold onto unmatched correlated receives before rejecting them. This is to address the race condition that is possible with one-way invokes and a resulting asynchronous callback. Briefly, it's possible for a response from a one-way invoke to arrive before the intended receive activity has executed. The spec says that the implementation needs to support that receive arriving prior to the execution of the invoke. The details can be found in Issue 33 of the WS-BPEL issues list.

setValidateServiceMessages

public void setValidateServiceMessages(boolean aFlag)
Determine if engine should validate all inbound and outbound messages. These are the messages used in receive, reply, invoke and onMessage.

                                 boolean aCreateFlag)
Retrieve the map entry from the config.

Parameters:
aName - The config entry name.
aCreateFlag - If true and the named map is null, it will be created and added to the config map.

getMapEntry

                                 boolean aCreateFlag,
                                 java.util.Map aConfigEntry)
Retrieve the map entry from the config.

Parameters:
aName - The config entry name.
aCreateFlag - If true and the named map is null, it will be created and added to the config map. aConfigEntry Map to containing entries.

addEntryByPath

public void addEntryByPath(java.lang.String aPath,
                           java.lang.String aSetting)
Descend into the config maps for the given path to set the value.

Parameters:
aPath - The path to the map. The path format will be something like foo/bar/debug where foo and bar are key names for map and debug is the key that will be added to the bar map (with the setting as its value).
aSetting - The value of the custom param.
